reviews.review:
Counter Strike was at one point, a team based game that used in-game communications, hyper realistic audio so you can pinpoint an enemy moving and a unique "realism" when firing weapons teaching gamers young and old how to handle recoil and stability. Spray patterns, taps, scopes or rushing with a Mac-10, this re-birthing of the counter strike series does what we already know, but better. The game has decent maps, an active community and a semi-reliable MMR comp. Most game modes are hostage rescue missions and bomb defuse runs. Play open casual with up to 20 players per lobby. 5v5 comp mode is the go-to for the progressive and hungry ranked player. Or do some wingman 2v2 partner work. As of the Free to play patch, Battle Royale mode has also been shoved into our thro...I mean, implemented for our fun. And it...is....just tops. Yeah.

On the other hand, every coin has the other side of things. The only downside is well, the community. It is legend toxic levels of absolute lack of humanity. If you have no spine, abandon hope all who enter. Cheaters are pretty common, if you have a low trust factor. You can now purchase a prime account instead of needing a phone, which is interesting. I feel as if people have an obsession with skins, to the point of it being more important than the actual game itself. It is a cesspool of memes and children when class is not in session and when it is, drop outs, manchildren and mouth breathers usually flood casual.

People are obsessed with gambling, malicious phishers flood the title, people will throw and the general moral of most games are terrible. High ranked games feel slighly sided but then again, I am one of the above mentioned (manchildren) who is in fact, not good. I am a nobody, But I do see things, I hear things. I know better. It feels like a literal hole where the worst in a person will come out. Pure racism, pure sexism, insane people preaching nonsense and soundbits and DJ's and every other annoyance.

Soooo, In short, I love this game. It is a good game. A fine game even. Just the game though. For the most part.
